categories.name: animal
categories.description: All animals, e.g. cats, rats, dogs, deer, birds.

categories.name: flat.driveable_surface
categories.description: Surfaces should be regarded with no concern of traffic rules, lanes etc. Exclude any road obstacles. This includes paved and unpaved surfaces

categories.name: human.pedestrian.adult
categories.description: Adult subcategory.

categories.name: human.pedestrian.child
categories.description: Child subcategory.

categories.name: human.pedestrian.construction_worker
categories.description: Construction worker

categories.name: human.pedestrian.personal_mobility
categories.description: A small electric or self-propelled vehicle, e.g. skateboard, segway, or scooters, on which the person typically travels in a upright position. Driver and (if applicable) rider should be included in the bounding box along with the vehicle.

categories.name: human.pedestrian.police_officer
categories.description: Police officer.

categories.name: human.pedestrian.stroller
categories.description: Strollers. If a person is in the stroller, include in the annotation.

categories.name: human.pedestrian.wheelchair
categories.description: Wheelchairs. If a person is in the wheelchair, include in the annotation.

categories.name: movable_object.barrier
categories.description: Temporary road barrier placed in the scene in order to redirect traffic. Commonly used at construction sites. This includes concrete barrier, metal barrier and water barrier. No fences.

categories.name: movable_object.debris
categories.description: Movable object that is left on the driveable surface that is too large to be driven over safely, e.g tree branch, full trash bag etc.

categories.name: movable_object.pushable_pullable
categories.description: Objects that a pedestrian may push or pull. For example dolleys, wheel barrows, garbage-bins, or shopping carts.

categories.name: movable_object.trafficcone
categories.description: All types of traffic cone.

categories.name: static_object.bicycle_rack
categories.description: Area or device intended to park or secure the bicycles in a row. It includes all the bikes parked in it and any empty slots that are intended for parking bikes.

categories.name: vehicle.bicycle
categories.description: Human or electric powered 2-wheeled vehicle designed to travel at lower speeds either on road surface, sidewalks or bike paths.

categories.name: vehicle.bus.bendy
categories.description: Bendy bus subcategory. Annotate each section of the bendy bus individually.

categories.name: vehicle.bus.rigid
categories.description: Rigid bus subcategory.

categories.name: vehicle.car
categories.description: Vehicle designed primarily for personal use, e.g. sedans, hatch-backs, wagons, vans, mini-vans, SUVs and jeeps. If the vehicle is designed to carry more than 10 people use vehicle.bus. If it is primarily designed to haul cargo use vehicle.truck.

categories.name: vehicle.construction
categories.description: Vehicles primarily designed for construction. Typically very slow moving or stationary. Cranes and extremities of construction vehicles are only included in annotations if they interfere with traffic. Trucks used to haul rocks or building materials are considered vehicle.truck rather than construction vehicles.

categories.name: vehicle.ego
categories.description: Ego vehicle.

categories.name: vehicle.emergency.ambulance
categories.description: All types of ambulances.

categories.name: vehicle.emergency.police
categories.description: All types of police vehicles including police bicycles and motorcycles.

categories.name: vehicle.motorcycle
categories.description: Gasoline or electric powered 2-wheeled vehicle designed to move rapidly (at the speed of standard cars) on the road surface. This category includes all motorcycles, vespas and scooters.

categories.name: vehicle.trailer
categories.description: Any vehicle trailer, both for trucks, cars and bikes.

categories.name: vehicle.truck
categories.description: Vehicles primarily designed to haul cargo including pick-ups, lorrys, trucks and semi-tractors. Trailers hauled after a semi-tractor should be labeled as vehicle.trailer

attributes.name: cycle_rider
attributes.description: Whether the cycle has a rider on it.

attributes.name: vehicle_light.emergency
attributes.description: Whether the emergency light of vehicle is lighting.

attributes.name: vehicle_position
attributes.description: Whether the object is on the ground plane.
